messages: 6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:33): Hi, I have a Samba server installed and I ran the nmbd and smbd daemons
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:33): How do I make a folder shared at this point?
9fccb8ae964e7db137f4145d8d83d4e2 (15:35): Talisker[w], you have to choose now between user and share security
9fccb8ae964e7db137f4145d8d83d4e2 (15:35): user means people access the share using some account (unix, ldap, blabla)
9fccb8ae964e7db137f4145d8d83d4e2 (15:35): share means that share has a password, and that's it
9fccb8ae964e7db137f4145d8d83d4e2 (15:36): Talisker[w], you have to think how you want to use the share
c01e287596d8d0bf8decfaee9613616a (15:36): windows 9x, nt uses user level
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:36): pmpfe, pretty simple, I want to mount a virtual drive of some particular files in my linux filesystem on a windows XP bos in the same network
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:37): pmpfe, not really, it's all behind a really tight firewall and is used only by authorized personel
9fccb8ae964e7db137f4145d8d83d4e2 (15:38): well, then you can just write something like
9fccb8ae964e7db137f4145d8d83d4e2 (15:39): here's what I did an hour ago to share my laptop mp3
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:42): assuming I want to use a single folder for sharing a few folders, would symlinks work?
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:44): pmpfe, is the "user" a local user or a remote user?
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:49): Windows did detect a change to it's firewall settings, and we allowed them
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:49): But I don't see any shared folder/machine
c01e287596d8d0bf8decfaee9613616a (15:53): Talisker[w]: dont count on browsing working, try running "\\machinename\sharename"
6f90c15c82c137e4e5df3df20d43de25 (15:58): How can I give windows access to folders that are only accessible by root without chmoding then?
c01e287596d8d0bf8decfaee9613616a (16:07): well, you can but its a bad idea
